revised_title: Observations on the Reproduction and Development of the Oviviviparous Shark
tldr: The author examines the reproductive and developmental processes of the oviviviparous shark, providing detailed descriptions of the male and female reproductive organs and the stages of egg development. The study reveals that the shark's reproductive process is similar to that of birds, with eggs contained in a membranous bag and young sharks remaining attached to their yolk sacs until they are capable of independent life.
